sources.title: Ten Laps to Go (1936) REX LEASE â™  DUNCAN RENALDO
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Duncan Renaldo, Muriel Evans, Rex Lease 
Produced by: Fanchon Royer

Champion race car drivers Larry Evans and Eddie DeSylva are fierce rivals for the checkered flag and for the love of a beautiful rich girl, but only one can be King of the Speedway!

Tragic Trivia: Marie Prevost, the actress who played the Cafe Waitress, was one of Mack Sennett's stars and a leading comedienne of the 1920s. Just a few weeks after this film's release,  she was found dead in her Hollywood apartment.

metadata.Plot: Larry Evans (Rex Lease), champion race car driver, is envied by his chief rival, Eddie DeSylva (Duncan Renaldo), who has more ambitions than merely winning the races; he has designs on the motor patent held by Corbett (Tom Moore), Larry's employer. Eddie also has a yen for Corbett's daughter, Norma (Muriel Evans), who prefers Larry. Eddie intentionally causes a race wreck that injures Larry and sends him to the hospital. Larry emerges from the hospital and finds his morale and courage has been broken when he falters while chasing some DeSylva henchmen who have robbed Corbett of some blueprints. But he regains his nerve and courage at the race track when he realizes that the driver hired to replace him, Barney Smith (Yakima Canutt), is working for DeSylva with intentions of throwing the race.
metadata.Actors: Rex Lease, Muriel Evans, Duncan Renaldo
